cue.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
cue.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Our success was the cue for other companies to press ahead with new investment.
I think that’s my cue to explain why I’m here.
cue.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a word, phrase, or action in a play that is a signal for the next person to speak or act
cue.translation[0].definitions[1].note.t: miss your cue (=not speak or act when you are supposed to)
cue.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
cue.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a long straight wooden stick used for hitting the ball in games such as billiards and pool
cue.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance
cue.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The studio manager will cue you when it’s your turn to come on.
